sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the front line in the Kupyansk region on Monday in a trip aimed at boosting morale.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: With depleted stocks of ammunition and a delay in a much-needed U.S. aid package, the Ukrainian leader says Russia is taking advantage and amassing maximum reserves at key points on the battlefront.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian troops have recently been forced to withdraw from the town of Advygha, having been outnumbered by Russian forces after four months of assault.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russia's Ministry of Defense has released footage of its troops taking back the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The victory is quote, positive for Russia, said Putin, days ahead of the two-year anniversary of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A Russian state broadcaster has also aired footage showing troops searching through the remains of the newly captured city for mines and booby traps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the reality is that Ivica has been left in ruins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russian troops are not thought to have any intention of lingering there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The latest reports say they are pushing on, seeking further advances in case Ukraine finally gets the ammunition supplies it needs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The death toll among Palestinians in Gaza has surpassed 29,000, according to the territory's health ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It marks another grim milestone in a truly destructive military campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed to continue the offensive until a quote, total victory against Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He has said troops will move into the southern town of Rafah, where over half of Gaza's 2.3 million people have sought refuge, if the remaining Israeli hostages are not released by start of Ramadan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Israeli military released a video showing what is believed to be two children and their mother being led through the streets of the town of Qanunis after their kidnapping on October 7.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The conflict has brought nearly daily exchanges of fire between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group which supports Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: On Monday, Israeli warplanes carried out two strikes on the port city of Sidon, saying the target was a Hezbollah weapons depot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny's widow, Yulia Navalnaya, has vowed to continue her husband's work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: She has been attending talks in Brussels with European Union foreign ministers to discuss how to make Russia accountable for her husband's death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Navalnaya was welcomed by the EU's top diplomat, Josep Borrell, who said he knows who to blame for her husband's death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the middle of the meeting, we received Yulia Navalnaya.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And we pay tribute to the memory of Alexei Navalny, that, as you know, he was slowly murdered in a Russian jail by Putin's regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I think these are the words.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Slowly murdered in a Russian jail by Putin's regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Yulia Navalnaya has previously avoided the political spotlight, but in a video recorded outside Russia, she says she will take on her husband's political fight for change in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Navalny's mother has gone to the penal colony in the Arctic where her son collapsed and died, according to authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: His body won't be released for a fortnight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: His wife is accusing them of hiding evidence of the real cause of death, which she says is poisoning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU is calling for an investigation along with fresh sanctions on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Navalny's death has resonated across Europe and beyond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Vigils are being held in numerous capitals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In Rome, a candlelight gathering was attended by hundreds of demonstrators expressing their anger following the death of Putin's fiercest foe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has declared her intention to run for a second term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: She made the announcement after a meeting with the leadership of the Christian Democratic Union Party in Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Five years ago, she decided to run for office rather ad hoc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This time, the situation is completely different, she says. Die Welt heute ist eine gänzlich andere als 2019. Wir haben gemeinsam viel durchgemacht in den vergangenen fünf Jahren und ich glaube, man kann sagen, wir haben mehr geschafft, als wir uns je vorstellen konnten.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In diesen fünf Jahren ist nicht nur meine Leidenschaft für Europa gewachsen, sondern natürlich auch meine Erfahrung, wie viel dieses Europa für seine Menschen leisten kann. but also my experience of how much this Europe can do for its people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: von der Leyen will now stand as the European People's Party lead candidate in the European Parliament elections in June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: By announcing her candidacy, von der Leyen has put an end to a months-long speculation about her political future.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Her second term in Brussels would have one overriding objective, she says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We want to strengthen democracy of Europe in the European Union and we want to address all the challenges around us, but in a way that people know that there is safety and security within the European Union for them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: For many across the world, von der Leyen has become the main European interlocutor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Her re-election would ensure continuity as the world faces multiple crises.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ursula von der Leyen was approved by the European Parliament on the 16th of July 2019 to be

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: President of the European Commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Soon she became one of the most influential leaders in Europe, but her mandate was heavily marked by different crises and lately overshadowed by criticism related to Europe's green transition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In March 2020, Europe faced lockdowns and panic due to the coronavirus. The Commission eventually opted for a joint vaccines procurement and set up a monetary fund to boost the economy. Both initiatives were welcomed across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The recovery fund, well, the basis that we take loans together and we stand in solidarity with each other, that was also progress. Unfortunately, the dissemination of the money was not enough bound to the Green Deal measurements and also the controlling mechanisms on how effectively this money is spent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Shortly after Vladimir Putin launched his war in Ukraine in 2022, Vondelyan travelled to Kyiv and Bucha to show Europe's support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Here in Bucha we saw our humanity being shattered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In the following months, the EU sanctioned Russia, cut energy ties with it, granted financial aid and weapons to Kyiv and eventually opened the way towards EU membership of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They belong to us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are one of us and we want them in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: These were all firsts under the leadership of von der Leyen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: She is combining really very good combination of personal, emotional and psychological, įvairi gerą kombinaciją personalinio, emocijoninio ir psichologinio, žinoma, apveikimo, kurių yra tik ukraininių ir europeinių, ir visada labai širdies praktinių visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų visų vis to be supported by clear steps, clear measures, and that is what Ursula von der Leyen really is able to achieve.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Critics say while von der Leyen was clearly committed to the Green Deal in the first years of her mandate, her enthusiasm has faded away due to lobbying from big businesses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: While her party, the EPP, tried to hijack the nature restoration law, the Commission watered down the car emissions phase-out and made various concessions to protesting farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: She has been giving in to this pressure substantially which was quite disappointing, not just for me as a member of the parliament but for big parts of society.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: If von der Leyen is elected again, she is likely to concentrate on EU defence policy, as well as reforming the bloc to be able to accept new members.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Astronomers at the European Southern Observatory say they have discovered what may be the brightest object in the universe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's a cassar with a black hole at its centre, some 12 billion light-years from Earth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Cassars are the bright cores at the centre of distant galaxies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Calculations indicate it's 500 trillion times brighter than the sun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This outshines tens of thousands of galaxies just like the Milky Way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So this is 10,000 times brighter than our entire Milky Way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the Milky Way is 100 billion stars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So this is one supermassive black hole versus 100 billion stars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The object was first detected in 1980, but was thought to be a star.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: That's now been changed by the latest observations in computer modelling, which show the Kassar is devouring the equivalent of 370 suns per year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's also still growing, but astronomers don't yet know how fast.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A strike at the Eiffel Tower leaves thousands of tourists unable to see one of the most visited monuments in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Unions said the strike is aimed at increasing salaries in proportion to the incoming revenue from ticket sales and improved maintenance of the monument which is owned by the Paris municipality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is resignation and disappointment among tourists. du monument et d'assurer la pérennité de l'entreprise dans laquelle on travaille.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Il y a une désappointement et une désappointement entre les touristes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: On était en vacances, on revenait pour voir la tour Eiffel, on reviendra un autre jour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Mais bon, les mouvements de grève, je trouve un petit peu défiguré un peu la France en montrant tous ces panneaux CGT envers les touristes étrangers. Je pense que ça salit un petit peu l'image de la France. disappointing. I came here for my birthday, but at least I still get to see it. I appreciate the workers wanting to keep the tower going for the next few hundred years that it can stand. The Eiffel Tower is typically open 365 days a year. Monday's closure is the second two months due to strikes.
